name: The State of the States Trivia Game | General | 10 Questions

questions.text: The official State Vegetable of Georgia is a Vidalia Onion.
questions.explanation:
true.

	Some say that they are sweet and mild in flavor, but I have had them a time or two and thought they were the hottest onion that I have ever had.

questions.text: As of 2002, Ohio is the most populous State bordering a Great Lake. True or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually it is New York which borders Lake Erie and Lake Ontario.

questions.text: The Ohio River forms the boundary between Indiana and Kentucky.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It also borders Ohio of course.

questions.text: The U.S. city of Virgilina got it name by combining both Virginia and North Carolina.
questions.explanation:
True.

	They decided this because of its location, it is in Virginia but on the border with North Carolina.

questions.text: In 1998, Florida became the first State to do away with polling places, passing a law to conduct its elections by mail-in ballot.
questions.explanation:
False.

	No, it was Oregon, although after all the stuff that happened in Florida with the presidential race, it would not shock me a bit if they did not follow in Oregon's footsteps.

questions.text: There are only three states that are smaller in land mass than Hawaii, and they are New Jersey, Delaware, and Connecticut.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They would be Rhode Island, Delaware and Connecticut.

questions.text: Slavery was first made legal in the American colony of Virginia.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually it was Massachusetts in 1641, Connecticut in 1650, and in Virginia in 1661.

questions.text: In Nevada there is a lonely stretch of road called the Extraterrestrial Highway.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It is a 100 mile section of Nevada State Highway 375 between Crystal Springs and Warm Springs. It runs just a few miles east of Nellis Air Force Base, where it is rumored that debris from a crashed flying saucer and the bodies of its alien occupants were taken in the 1950s.

questions.text: In 1856 Maine passed the first Prohibition Law in the United States.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The date was actually 1851. However, twelve other states then followed by passing similar laws banning the sale and consumption of intoxicating beverages.

questions.text: Oregon was the first state in 1887 to recognize Labor Day as a legal holiday.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was Colorado in March.
